title: Ticket #3507: Handle OpenStack's stopped state.
description:
HTCondor, when managing an instance on an OpenStack resource, will report that instance as running even after it has shut itself down. This is because OpenStack reports the instance as stopped, apparently disrespecting the InstanceInstantiatedShutdownBehavior flag. (HTCondor sets this flag to 'terminate' for all instances, specifically to avoid having to worry about reporting something intelligent when an instance is no longer costing the user money, but its persistent data is.)

Tony, we believe that treating 'shutoff' instances (see #3367) and 'stopped' instances identically will suffice to handle this problem.

If user demand subsequently materializes, we can revisit this decision, possibly using the HTCondor suspended state to more intuitively/accurately approximate the actual state of the instance.
